<s> invasions by norsemen that began in the late 8th century were finally ended when king brian boru defeated the danes in 1014 <\s>
<s> english invasions began in the 12th century and set off more than seven centuries of anglo-irish struggle marked by fierce rebellions and harsh repressions <\s>
<s> a failed 1916 easter monday rebellion touched off several years of guerrilla warfare that in 1921 resulted in independence from the uk for 26 southern counties six northern ulster counties remained part of the uk <\s>
<s> in 1949 ireland withdrew from the british commonwealth it joined the european community in 1973 <\s>
<s> irish governments have sought the peaceful unification of ireland and have cooperated with britain against terrorist groups <\s>
<s> a peace settlement for northern ireland is gradually being implemented despite some difficulties <\s>
<s> in 2006 the irish and british governments developed and began to implement the st <\s>
<s> andrews agreement building on the good friday agreement approved in 1998 <\s>
<s> isle of man part of the norwegian kingdom of the hebrides until the 13th century when it was ceded to scotland the isle came under the british crown in 1765 <\s>
<s> current concerns include reviving the almost extinct manx gaelic language <\s>
<s> isle of man is a british crown dependency but is not part of the uk or of the european union <\s>
<s> however the uk government remains constitutionally responsible for its defense and international representation <\s>
<s> israel following world war ii the british withdrew from their mandate of palestine and the un partitioned the area into arab and jewish states an arrangement rejected by the arabs <\s>
<s> subsequently the israelis defeated the arabs in a series of wars without ending the deep tensions between the two sides <\s>
<s> the territories israel occupied since the 1967 war are not included in the israel country profile unless otherwise noted <\s>
<s> on 25 april 1982 israel withdrew from the sinai pursuant to the 1979 israel-egypt peace treaty <\s>
<s> disputes between a series of prisoner popes and italy were resolved in 1929 by three lateran treaties which established the independent state of vatican city and granted roman catholicism special status in italy <\s>
<s> in 1984 a concordat between the holy see and italy modified certain of the earlier treaty provisions including the primacy of roman catholicism as the italian state religion <\s>
<s> present concerns of the holy see include religious freedom international development the environment the middle east china the decline of religion in europe terrorism interreligious dialogue and reconciliation and the application of church doctrine in an era of rapid change and globalization <\s>
<s> about one billion people worldwide profess the catholic faith <\s>
<s> honduras once part of spain's vast empire in the new world honduras became an independent nation in 1821 <\s>
<s> after two and a half decades of mostly military rule a freely elected civilian government came to power in 1982 <\s>
<s> during the 1980s honduras proved a haven for anti-sandinista contras fighting the marxist nicaraguan government and an ally to salvadoran government forces fighting leftist guerrillas <\s>
<s> the country was devastated by hurricane mitch in 1998 which killed about 5,600 people and caused approximately 2 billion in damage <\s>
<s> since then the economy has slowly rebounded <\s>
<s> hong kong occupied by the uk in 1841 hong kong was formally ceded by china the following year various adjacent lands were added later in the 19th century <\s>
<s> pursuant to an agreement signed by china and the uk on 19 december 1984 hong kong became the hong kong special administrative region sar of the people's republic of china on 1 july 1997 <\s>
<s> in this agreement china promised that under its one country two systems formula china's socialist economic system would not be imposed on hong kong and that hong kong would enjoy a high degree of autonomy in all matters except foreign and defense affairs for the next 50 years <\s>
<s> hungary hungary became a christian kingdom in a d <\s>
<s> 1000 and for many centuries served as a bulwark against ottoman turkish expansion in europe <\s>
<s> the kingdom eventually became part of the polyglot austro-hungarian empire which collapsed during world war i <\s>
<s> the country fell under communist rule following world war ii <\s>
<s> in 1956 a revolt and an announced withdrawal from the warsaw pact were met with a massive military intervention by moscow <\s>
<s> under the leadership of janos kadar in 1968 hungary began liberalizing its economy introducing so-called goulash communism <\s>
<s> hungary held its first multiparty elections in 1990 and initiated a free market economy <\s>
<s> it joined nato in 1999 and the eu in 2004 <\s>
<s> iceland settled by norwegian and celtic scottish and irish immigrants during the late 9th and 10th centuries a d iceland boasts the world's oldest functioning legislative assembly the althing established in 930 <\s>
<s> independent for over 300 years iceland was subsequently ruled by norway and denmark <\s>
<s> fallout from the askja volcano of 1875 devastated the icelandic economy and caused widespread famine <\s>
<s> over the next quarter century 20 of the island's population emigrated mostly to canada and the us <\s>
<s> limited home rule from denmark was granted in 1874 and complete independence attained in 1944 <\s>
<s> the second half of the 20th century saw substantial economic growth driven primarily by the fishing industry <\s>
<s> the economy diversified greatly after the country joined the european economic area in 1994 but iceland was especially hard hit by the global financial crisis in the years following 2008 <\s>
<s> literacy longevity and social cohesion are first rate by world standards <\s>
<s> india the indus valley civilization one of the world's oldest flourished during the 3rd and 2nd millennia b c <\s>
<s> and extended into northwestern india <\s>
<s> aryan tribes from the northwest infiltrated onto the indian subcontinent about 1500 b c their merger with the earlier dravidian inhabitants created the classical indian culture <\s>
<s> the maurya empire of the 4th and 3rd centuries b c <\s>
<s> which reached its zenith under ashoka united much of south asia <\s>
<s> the golden age ushered in by the gupta dynasty 4th to 6th centuries a d saw a flowering of indian science art and culture <\s>
<s> islam spread across the subcontinent over a period of 700 years <\s>
<s> in the 10th and 11th centuries turks and afghans invaded india and established the delhi sultanate <\s>
<s> in the early 16th century the emperor babur established the mughal dynasty which ruled india for more than three centuries <\s>
<s> european explorers began establishing footholds in india during the 16th century <\s>
<s> by the 19th century great britain had become the dominant political power on the subcontinent <\s>
<s> the british indian army played a vital role in both world wars <\s>
<s> nonviolent resistance to british rule led by mohandas gandhi and jawaharlal nehru eventually brought about independence in 1947 <\s>
<s> communal violence led to the subcontinent's bloody partition which resulted in the creation of two separate states india and pakistan <\s>
<s> the two countries have fought three wars since independence the last of which in 1971 resulted in east pakistan becoming the separate nation of bangladesh <\s>
<s> india's nuclear weapons tests in 1998 caused pakistan to conduct its own tests that same year <\s>
<s> in november 2008 terrorists allegedly originating from pakistan conducted a series of coordinated attacks in mumbai india's financial capital <\s>
<s> despite pressing problems such as significant overpopulation environmental degradation extensive poverty and widespread corruption rapid economic development is fueling india's rise on the world stage <\s>
<s> in january 2011 india assumed a nonpermanent seat in the un security council for the 2011-12 term <\s>
<s> indian ocean the indian ocean is the third largest of the world's five oceans after the pacific ocean and atlantic ocean but larger than the southern ocean and arctic ocean <\s>
<s> four critically important access waterways are the suez canal egypt bab el mandeb djibouti-yemen strait of hormuz iran-oman and strait of malacca indonesia-malaysia <\s>
<s> the decision by the international hydrographic organization in the spring of 2000 to delimit a fifth ocean the southern ocean removed the portion of the indian ocean south of 60 degrees south latitude <\s>
<s> indonesia the dutch began to colonize indonesia in the early 17th century japan occupied the islands from 1942 to 1945 <\s>
<s> indonesia declared its independence after japan's surrender but it required four years of intermittent negotiations recurring hostilities and un mediation before the netherlands agreed to transfer sovereignty in 1949 <\s>
<s> free and fair legislative elections took place in 1999 after decades of repressive rule <\s>
<s> indonesia is now the world's third most populous democracy the world's largest archipelagic state and home to the world's largest muslim population <\s>
<s> current issues include alleviating poverty improving education preventing terrorism consolidating democracy after four decades of authoritarianism implementing economic and financial reforms stemming corruption holding the military and police accountable for human rights violations addressing climate change and controlling avian influenza <\s>
<s> in 2005 indonesia reached a historic peace agreement with armed separatists in aceh which led to democratic elections in aceh in december 2006 <\s>
<s> indonesia continues to face low intensity armed resistance by the separatist free papua movement <\s>
<s> iran known as persia until 1935 iran became an islamic republic in 1979 after the ruling monarchy was overthrown and shah mohammad reza pahlavi was forced into exile <\s>
<s> conservative clerical forces established a theocratic system of government with ultimate political authority vested in a learned religious scholar referred to commonly as the supreme leader who according to the constitution is accountable only to the assembly of experts a popularly elected 86 member body of clerics <\s>
<s> us-iranian relations have been strained since a group of iranian students seized the us embassy in tehran on 4 november 1979 and held it until 20 january 1981 <\s>
<s> during 1980-88 iran fought a bloody indecisive war with iraq that eventually expanded into the persian gulf and led to clashes between us navy and iranian military forces between 1987 and 1988 <\s>
<s> iran has been designated a state sponsor of terrorism for its activities in lebanon and elsewhere in the world and remains subject to us un and eu economic sanctions and export controls because of its continued involvement in terrorism and its nuclear weapons ambitions <\s>
<s> following the election of reformer hojjat ol-eslam mohammad khatami as president in 1997 and a reformist majles legislature in 2000 a campaign to foster political reform in response to popular dissatisfaction was initiated <\s>
<s> the movement floundered as conservative politicians through the control of unelected institutions prevented reform measures from being enacted and increased repressive measures <\s>
<s> starting with nationwide municipal elections in 2003 and continuing through majles elections in 2004 conservatives reestablished control over iran's elected government institutions which culminated with the august 2005 inauguration of hardliner mahmud ahmadi-nejad as president <\s>
<s> his controversial reelection in june 2009 sparked nationwide protests over allegations of electoral fraud <\s>
<s> the un security council has passed a number of resolutions 1696 in july 2006 1737 in december 2006 1747 in march 2007 1803 in march 2008 and 1835 in september 2008 calling for iran to suspend its uranium enrichment and reprocessing activities and comply with its iaea obligations and responsibilities <\s>
<s> resolutions 1737 1477 and 1803 subject a number of iranian individuals and entities involved in iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs to sanctions <\s>
<s> additionally several iranian entities are subject to us sanctions under executive order 13382 designations for proliferation activities and eo 13224 designations for support of terrorism <\s>
<s> iraq formerly part of the ottoman empire iraq was occupied by britain during the course of world war i in 1920 it was declared a league of nations mandate under uk administration <\s>
<s> in stages over the next dozen years iraq attained its independence as a kingdom in 1932 <\s>
<s> a republic was proclaimed in 1958 but in actuality a series of strongmen ruled the country until 2003 <\s>
<s> the last was saddam husayn <\s>
<s> territorial disputes with iran led to an inconclusive and costly eight-year war 1980-88 <\s>
<s> in august 1990 iraq seized kuwait but was expelled by us-led un coalition forces during the gulf war of january-february 1991 <\s>
<s> following kuwait's liberation the un security council unsc required iraq to scrap all weapons of mass destruction and long-range missiles and to allow un verification inspections <\s>
<s> continued iraqi noncompliance with unsc resolutions over a period of 12 years led to the us-led invasion of iraq in march 2003 and the ouster of the saddam husayn regime <\s>
<s> us forces remained in iraq under a unsc mandate through 2009 and under a bilateral security agreement thereafter helping to provide security and to train and mentor iraqi security forces <\s>
<s> in october 2005 iraqis approved a constitution in a national referendum and pursuant to this document elected a 275 member council of representatives cor in december 2005 <\s>
<s> after the election ibrahim al-jafari was selected as prime minister he was replaced by nuri al-maliki in may 2006 <\s>
<s> the cor approved most cabinet ministers in may 2006 marking the transition to iraq's first constitutional government in nearly a half century <\s>
<s> on 31 january 2009 iraq held elections for provincial councils in all provinces except for the three provinces comprising the kurdistan regional government and kirkuk province <\s>
<s> iraq held a national legislative election in march 2010 and after nine months of deadlock the cor approved the new government in december <\s>
<s> ireland celtic tribes arrived on the island between 600-150 b c <\s>
<s> invasions by norsemen that began in the late 8th century were finally ended when king brian boru defeated the danes in 1014 <\s>
<s> english invasions began in the 12th century and set off more than seven centuries of anglo-irish struggle marked by fierce rebellions and harsh repressions <\s>
<s> a failed 1916 easter monday rebellion touched off several years of guerrilla warfare that in 1921 resulted in independence from the uk for 26 southern counties six northern ulster counties remained part of the uk <\s>
<s> in 1949 ireland withdrew from the british commonwealth it joined the european community in 1973 <\s>
<s> irish governments have sought the peaceful unification of ireland and have cooperated with britain against terrorist groups <\s>

<s> since then the economy has slowly rebounded <\s>
<s> hong kong occupied by the uk in 1841 hong kong was formally ceded by china the following year various adjacent lands were added later in the 19th century <\s>
<s> pursuant to an agreement signed by china and the uk on 19 december 1984 hong kong became the hong kong special administrative region sar of the people's republic of china on 1 july 1997 <\s>
<s> in this agreement china promised that under its one country two systems formula china's socialist economic system would not be imposed on hong kong and that hong kong would enjoy a high degree of autonomy in all matters except foreign and defense affairs for the next 50 years <\s>
<s> hungary hungary became a christian kingdom in a d <\s>
<s> 1000 and for many centuries served as a bulwark against ottoman turkish expansion in europe <\s>
<s> the kingdom eventually became part of the polyglot austro-hungarian empire which collapsed during world war i <\s>
<s> the country fell under communist rule following world war ii <\s>
<s> in 1956 a revolt and an announced withdrawal from the warsaw pact were met with a massive military intervention by moscow <\s>
<s> under the leadership of janos kadar in 1968 hungary began liberalizing its economy introducing so-called goulash communism <\s>
<s> hungary held its first multiparty elections in 1990 and initiated a free market economy <\s>
<s> it joined nato in 1999 and the eu in 2004 <\s>
<s> iceland settled by norwegian and celtic scottish and irish immigrants during the late 9th and 10th centuries a d iceland boasts the world's oldest functioning legislative assembly the althing established in 930 <\s>
<s> independent for over 300 years iceland was subsequently ruled by norway and denmark <\s>
<s> fallout from the askja volcano of 1875 devastated the icelandic economy and caused widespread famine <\s>
<s> over the next quarter century 20 of the island's population emigrated mostly to canada and the us <\s>
<s> limited home rule from denmark was granted in 1874 and complete independence attained in 1944 <\s>
<s> the second half of the 20th century saw substantial economic growth driven primarily by the fishing industry <\s>
<s> the economy diversified greatly after the country joined the european economic area in 1994 but iceland was especially hard hit by the global financial crisis in the years following 2008 <\s>
<s> literacy longevity and social cohesion are first rate by world standards <\s>
<s> india the indus valley civilization one of the world's oldest flourished during the 3rd and 2nd millennia b c <\s>
<s> and extended into northwestern india <\s>
<s> aryan tribes from the northwest infiltrated onto the indian subcontinent about 1500 b c their merger with the earlier dravidian inhabitants created the classical indian culture <\s>
<s> the maurya empire of the 4th and 3rd centuries b c <\s>
<s> which reached its zenith under ashoka united much of south asia <\s>
<s> the golden age ushered in by the gupta dynasty 4th to 6th centuries a d saw a flowering of indian science art and culture <\s>
<s> islam spread across the subcontinent over a period of 700 years <\s>
<s> in the 10th and 11th centuries turks and afghans invaded india and established the delhi sultanate <\s>
<s> in the early 16th century the emperor babur established the mughal dynasty which ruled india for more than three centuries <\s>
<s> european explorers began establishing footholds in india during the 16th century <\s>
<s> by the 19th century great britain had become the dominant political power on the subcontinent <\s>
<s> the british indian army played a vital role in both world wars <\s>
<s> nonviolent resistance to british rule led by mohandas gandhi and jawaharlal nehru eventually brought about independence in 1947 <\s>
<s> communal violence led to the subcontinent's bloody partition which resulted in the creation of two separate states india and pakistan <\s>
<s> the two countries have fought three wars since independence the last of which in 1971 resulted in east pakistan becoming the separate nation of bangladesh <\s>
<s> india's nuclear weapons tests in 1998 caused pakistan to conduct its own tests that same year <\s>
<s> in november 2008 terrorists allegedly originating from pakistan conducted a series of coordinated attacks in mumbai india's financial capital <\s>
<s> despite pressing problems such as significant overpopulation environmental degradation extensive poverty and widespread corruption rapid economic development is fueling india's rise on the world stage <\s>
<s> in january 2011 india assumed a nonpermanent seat in the un security council for the 2011-12 term <\s>
<s> indian ocean the indian ocean is the third largest of the world's five oceans after the pacific ocean and atlantic ocean but larger than the southern ocean and arctic ocean <\s>
<s> four critically important access waterways are the suez canal egypt bab el mandeb djibouti-yemen strait of hormuz iran-oman and strait of malacca indonesia-malaysia <\s>
<s> the decision by the international hydrographic organization in the spring of 2000 to delimit a fifth ocean the southern ocean removed the portion of the indian ocean south of 60 degrees south latitude <\s>
<s> indonesia the dutch began to colonize indonesia in the early 17th century japan occupied the islands from 1942 to 1945 <\s>
<s> indonesia declared its independence after japan's surrender but it required four years of intermittent negotiations recurring hostilities and un mediation before the netherlands agreed to transfer sovereignty in 1949 <\s>
<s> free and fair legislative elections took place in 1999 after decades of repressive rule <\s>
<s> indonesia is now the world's third most populous democracy the world's largest archipelagic state and home to the world's largest muslim population <\s>
<s> current issues include alleviating poverty improving education preventing terrorism consolidating democracy after four decades of authoritarianism implementing economic and financial reforms stemming corruption holding the military and police accountable for human rights violations addressing climate change and controlling avian influenza <\s>
<s> in 2005 indonesia reached a historic peace agreement with armed separatists in aceh which led to democratic elections in aceh in december 2006 <\s>
<s> indonesia continues to face low intensity armed resistance by the separatist free papua movement <\s>
<s> iran known as persia until 1935 iran became an islamic republic in 1979 after the ruling monarchy was overthrown and shah mohammad reza pahlavi was forced into exile <\s>
<s> conservative clerical forces established a theocratic system of government with ultimate political authority vested in a learned religious scholar referred to commonly as the supreme leader who according to the constitution is accountable only to the assembly of experts a popularly elected 86 member body of clerics <\s>
<s> us-iranian relations have been strained since a group of iranian students seized the us embassy in tehran on 4 november 1979 and held it until 20 january 1981 <\s>
<s> during 1980-88 iran fought a bloody indecisive war with iraq that eventually expanded into the persian gulf and led to clashes between us navy and iranian military forces between 1987 and 1988 <\s>
<s> iran has been designated a state sponsor of terrorism for its activities in lebanon and elsewhere in the world and remains subject to us un and eu economic sanctions and export controls because of its continued involvement in terrorism and its nuclear weapons ambitions <\s>
<s> following the election of reformer hojjat ol-eslam mohammad khatami as president in 1997 and a reformist majles legislature in 2000 a campaign to foster political reform in response to popular dissatisfaction was initiated <\s>
<s> the movement floundered as conservative politicians through the control of unelected institutions prevented reform measures from being enacted and increased repressive measures <\s>
<s> starting with nationwide municipal elections in 2003 and continuing through majles elections in 2004 conservatives reestablished control over iran's elected government institutions which culminated with the august 2005 inauguration of hardliner mahmud ahmadi-nejad as president <\s>
<s> his controversial reelection in june 2009 sparked nationwide protests over allegations of electoral fraud <\s>
<s> the un security council has passed a number of resolutions 1696 in july 2006 1737 in december 2006 1747 in march 2007 1803 in march 2008 and 1835 in september 2008 calling for iran to suspend its uranium enrichment and reprocessing activities and comply with its iaea obligations and responsibilities <\s>
<s> resolutions 1737 1477 and 1803 subject a number of iranian individuals and entities involved in iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs to sanctions <\s>
<s> additionally several iranian entities are subject to us sanctions under executive order 13382 designations for proliferation activities and eo 13224 designations for support of terrorism <\s>
<s> iraq formerly part of the ottoman empire iraq was occupied by britain during the course of world war i in 1920 it was declared a league of nations mandate under uk administration <\s>
<s> in stages over the next dozen years iraq attained its independence as a kingdom in 1932 <\s>
<s> a republic was proclaimed in 1958 but in actuality a series of strongmen ruled the country until 2003 <\s>
<s> the last was saddam husayn <\s>
<s> territorial disputes with iran led to an inconclusive and costly eight-year war 1980-88 <\s>
<s> in august 1990 iraq seized kuwait but was expelled by us-led un coalition forces during the gulf war of january-february 1991 <\s>
<s> following kuwait's liberation the un security council unsc required iraq to scrap all weapons of mass destruction and long-range missiles and to allow un verification inspections <\s>
<s> continued iraqi noncompliance with unsc resolutions over a period of 12 years led to the us-led invasion of iraq in march 2003 and the ouster of the saddam husayn regime <\s>
<s> us forces remained in iraq under a unsc mandate through 2009 and under a bilateral security agreement thereafter helping to provide security and to train and mentor iraqi security forces <\s>
<s> in october 2005 iraqis approved a constitution in a national referendum and pursuant to this document elected a 275 member council of representatives cor in december 2005 <\s>
<s> after the election ibrahim al-jafari was selected as prime minister he was replaced by nuri al-maliki in may 2006 <\s>
<s> the cor approved most cabinet ministers in may 2006 marking the transition to iraq's first constitutional government in nearly a half century <\s>
<s> on 31 january 2009 iraq held elections for provincial councils in all provinces except for the three provinces comprising the kurdistan regional government and kirkuk province <\s>
<s> iraq held a national legislative election in march 2010 and after nine months of deadlock the cor approved the new government in december <\s>
<s> ireland celtic tribes arrived on the island between 600-150 b c <\s>
<s> invasions by norsemen that began in the late 8th century were finally ended when king brian boru defeated the danes in 1014 <\s>
<s> english invasions began in the 12th century and set off more than seven centuries of anglo-irish struggle marked by fierce rebellions and harsh repressions <\s>
<s> a failed 1916 easter monday rebellion touched off several years of guerrilla warfare that in 1921 resulted in independence from the uk for 26 southern counties six northern ulster counties remained part of the uk <\s>
<s> in 1949 ireland withdrew from the british commonwealth it joined the european community in 1973 <\s>
<s> irish governments have sought the peaceful unification of ireland and have cooperated with britain against terrorist groups <\s>
<s> a peace settlement for northern ireland is gradually being implemented despite some difficulties <\s>
<s> in 2006 the irish and british governments developed and began to implement the st <\s>
<s> andrews agreement building on the good friday agreement approved in 1998 <\s>
<s> isle of man part of the norwegian kingdom of the hebrides until the 13th century when it was ceded to scotland the isle came under the british crown in 1765 <\s>
<s> current concerns include reviving the almost extinct manx gaelic language <\s>
<s> isle of man is a british crown dependency but is not part of the uk or of the european union <\s>
<s> however the uk government remains constitutionally responsible for its defense and international representation <\s>
<s> israel following world war ii the british withdrew from their mandate of palestine and the un partitioned the area into arab and jewish states an arrangement rejected by the arabs <\s>
<s> subsequently the israelis defeated the arabs in a series of wars without ending the deep tensions between the two sides <\s>
<s> the territories israel occupied since the 1967 war are not included in the israel country profile unless otherwise noted <\s>
<s> on 25 april 1982 israel withdrew from the sinai pursuant to the 1979 israel-egypt peace treaty <\s>
<s> disputes between a series of prisoner popes and italy were resolved in 1929 by three lateran treaties which established the independent state of vatican city and granted roman catholicism special status in italy <\s>
<s> in 1984 a concordat between the holy see and italy modified certain of the earlier treaty provisions including the primacy of roman catholicism as the italian state religion <\s>
<s> present concerns of the holy see include religious freedom international development the environment the middle east china the decline of religion in europe terrorism interreligious dialogue and reconciliation and the application of church doctrine in an era of rapid change and globalization <\s>
<s> about one billion people worldwide profess the catholic faith <\s>
<s> honduras once part of spain's vast empire in the new world honduras became an independent nation in 1821 <\s>
<s> after two and a half decades of mostly military rule a freely elected civilian government came to power in 1982 <\s>
<s> during the 1980s honduras proved a haven for anti-sandinista contras fighting the marxist nicaraguan government and an ally to salvadoran government forces fighting leftist guerrillas <\s>
<s> the country was devastated by hurricane mitch in 1998 which killed about 5,600 people and caused approximately 2 billion in damage <\s>
<s> since then the economy has slowly rebounded <\s>
<s> hong kong occupied by the uk in 1841 hong kong was formally ceded by china the following year various adjacent lands were added later in the 19th century <\s>
<s> pursuant to an agreement signed by china and the uk on 19 december 1984 hong kong became the hong kong special administrative region sar of the people's republic of china on 1 july 1997 <\s>
<s> in this agreement china promised that under its one country two systems formula china's socialist economic system would not be imposed on hong kong and that hong kong would enjoy a high degree of autonomy in all matters except foreign and defense affairs for the next 50 years <\s>

<s> in the early 16th century the emperor babur established the mughal dynasty which ruled india for more than three centuries <\s>
<s> european explorers began establishing footholds in india during the 16th century <\s>
<s> by the 19th century great britain had become the dominant political power on the subcontinent <\s>
<s> the british indian army played a vital role in both world wars <\s>
<s> nonviolent resistance to british rule led by mohandas gandhi and jawaharlal nehru eventually brought about independence in 1947 <\s>
<s> communal violence led to the subcontinent's bloody partition which resulted in the creation of two separate states india and pakistan <\s>
<s> the two countries have fought three wars since independence the last of which in 1971 resulted in east pakistan becoming the separate nation of bangladesh <\s>
<s> india's nuclear weapons tests in 1998 caused pakistan to conduct its own tests that same year <\s>
<s> in november 2008 terrorists allegedly originating from pakistan conducted a series of coordinated attacks in mumbai india's financial capital <\s>
<s> despite pressing problems such as significant overpopulation environmental degradation extensive poverty and widespread corruption rapid economic development is fueling india's rise on the world stage <\s>
<s> in january 2011 india assumed a nonpermanent seat in the un security council for the 2011-12 term <\s>
<s> indian ocean the indian ocean is the third largest of the world's five oceans after the pacific ocean and atlantic ocean but larger than the southern ocean and arctic ocean <\s>
<s> four critically important access waterways are the suez canal egypt bab el mandeb djibouti-yemen strait of hormuz iran-oman and strait of malacca indonesia-malaysia <\s>
<s> the decision by the international hydrographic organization in the spring of 2000 to delimit a fifth ocean the southern ocean removed the portion of the indian ocean south of 60 degrees south latitude <\s>
<s> indonesia the dutch began to colonize indonesia in the early 17th century japan occupied the islands from 1942 to 1945 <\s>
<s> indonesia declared its independence after japan's surrender but it required four years of intermittent negotiations recurring hostilities and un mediation before the netherlands agreed to transfer sovereignty in 1949 <\s>
<s> free and fair legislative elections took place in 1999 after decades of repressive rule <\s>
<s> indonesia is now the world's third most populous democracy the world's largest archipelagic state and home to the world's largest muslim population <\s>
<s> current issues include alleviating poverty improving education preventing terrorism consolidating democracy after four decades of authoritarianism implementing economic and financial reforms stemming corruption holding the military and police accountable for human rights violations addressing climate change and controlling avian influenza <\s>
<s> in 2005 indonesia reached a historic peace agreement with armed separatists in aceh which led to democratic elections in aceh in december 2006 <\s>
<s> indonesia continues to face low intensity armed resistance by the separatist free papua movement <\s>
<s> iran known as persia until 1935 iran became an islamic republic in 1979 after the ruling monarchy was overthrown and shah mohammad reza pahlavi was forced into exile <\s>
<s> conservative clerical forces established a theocratic system of government with ultimate political authority vested in a learned religious scholar referred to commonly as the supreme leader who according to the constitution is accountable only to the assembly of experts a popularly elected 86 member body of clerics <\s>
<s> us-iranian relations have been strained since a group of iranian students seized the us embassy in tehran on 4 november 1979 and held it until 20 january 1981 <\s>
<s> during 1980-88 iran fought a bloody indecisive war with iraq that eventually expanded into the persian gulf and led to clashes between us navy and iranian military forces between 1987 and 1988 <\s>
<s> iran has been designated a state sponsor of terrorism for its activities in lebanon and elsewhere in the world and remains subject to us un and eu economic sanctions and export controls because of its continued involvement in terrorism and its nuclear weapons ambitions <\s>
<s> following the election of reformer hojjat ol-eslam mohammad khatami as president in 1997 and a reformist majles legislature in 2000 a campaign to foster political reform in response to popular dissatisfaction was initiated <\s>
<s> the movement floundered as conservative politicians through the control of unelected institutions prevented reform measures from being enacted and increased repressive measures <\s>
<s> starting with nationwide municipal elections in 2003 and continuing through majles elections in 2004 conservatives reestablished control over iran's elected government institutions which culminated with the august 2005 inauguration of hardliner mahmud ahmadi-nejad as president <\s>
<s> his controversial reelection in june 2009 sparked nationwide protests over allegations of electoral fraud <\s>
<s> the un security council has passed a number of resolutions 1696 in july 2006 1737 in december 2006 1747 in march 2007 1803 in march 2008 and 1835 in september 2008 calling for iran to suspend its uranium enrichment and reprocessing activities and comply with its iaea obligations and responsibilities <\s>
<s> resolutions 1737 1477 and 1803 subject a number of iranian individuals and entities involved in iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs to sanctions <\s>
<s> additionally several iranian entities are subject to us sanctions under executive order 13382 designations for proliferation activities and eo 13224 designations for support of terrorism <\s>
<s> iraq formerly part of the ottoman empire iraq was occupied by britain during the course of world war i in 1920 it was declared a league of nations mandate under uk administration <\s>
<s> in stages over the next dozen years iraq attained its independence as a kingdom in 1932 <\s>
<s> a republic was proclaimed in 1958 but in actuality a series of strongmen ruled the country until 2003 <\s>
<s> the last was saddam husayn <\s>
<s> territorial disputes with iran led to an inconclusive and costly eight-year war 1980-88 <\s>
<s> in august 1990 iraq seized kuwait but was expelled by us-led un coalition forces during the gulf war of january-february 1991 <\s>
<s> following kuwait's liberation the un security council unsc required iraq to scrap all weapons of mass destruction and long-range missiles and to allow un verification inspections <\s>
<s> continued iraqi noncompliance with unsc resolutions over a period of 12 years led to the us-led invasion of iraq in march 2003 and the ouster of the saddam husayn regime <\s>
<s> us forces remained in iraq under a unsc mandate through 2009 and under a bilateral security agreement thereafter helping to provide security and to train and mentor iraqi security forces <\s>
<s> in october 2005 iraqis approved a constitution in a national referendum and pursuant to this document elected a 275 member council of representatives cor in december 2005 <\s>
<s> after the election ibrahim al-jafari was selected as prime minister he was replaced by nuri al-maliki in may 2006 <\s>
<s> the cor approved most cabinet ministers in may 2006 marking the transition to iraq's first constitutional government in nearly a half century <\s>
<s> on 31 january 2009 iraq held elections for provincial councils in all provinces except for the three provinces comprising the kurdistan regional government and kirkuk province <\s>
<s> iraq held a national legislative election in march 2010 and after nine months of deadlock the cor approved the new government in december <\s>
<s> ireland celtic tribes arrived on the island between 600-150 b c <\s>
<s> invasions by norsemen that began in the late 8th century were finally ended when king brian boru defeated the danes in 1014 <\s>
<s> english invasions began in the 12th century and set off more than seven centuries of anglo-irish struggle marked by fierce rebellions and harsh repressions <\s>
<s> a failed 1916 easter monday rebellion touched off several years of guerrilla warfare that in 1921 resulted in independence from the uk for 26 southern counties six northern ulster counties remained part of the uk <\s>
<s> in 1949 ireland withdrew from the british commonwealth it joined the european community in 1973 <\s>
<s> irish governments have sought the peaceful unification of ireland and have cooperated with britain against terrorist groups <\s>
<s> a peace settlement for northern ireland is gradually being implemented despite some difficulties <\s>
<s> in 2006 the irish and british governments developed and began to implement the st <\s>
<s> andrews agreement building on the good friday agreement approved in 1998 <\s>
<s> isle of man part of the norwegian kingdom of the hebrides until the 13th century when it was ceded to scotland the isle came under the british crown in 1765 <\s>
<s> current concerns include reviving the almost extinct manx gaelic language <\s>
<s> isle of man is a british crown dependency but is not part of the uk or of the european union <\s>
<s> however the uk government remains constitutionally responsible for its defense and international representation <\s>
<s> israel following world war ii the british withdrew from their mandate of palestine and the un partitioned the area into arab and jewish states an arrangement rejected by the arabs <\s>
<s> subsequently the israelis defeated the arabs in a series of wars without ending the deep tensions between the two sides <\s>
<s> the territories israel occupied since the 1967 war are not included in the israel country profile unless otherwise noted <\s>
<s> on 25 april 1982 israel withdrew from the sinai pursuant to the 1979 israel-egypt peace treaty <\s>
<s> disputes between a series of prisoner popes and italy were resolved in 1929 by three lateran treaties which established the independent state of vatican city and granted roman catholicism special status in italy <\s>
<s> in 1984 a concordat between the holy see and italy modified certain of the earlier treaty provisions including the primacy of roman catholicism as the italian state religion <\s>
<s> present concerns of the holy see include religious freedom international development the environment the middle east china the decline of religion in europe terrorism interreligious dialogue and reconciliation and the application of church doctrine in an era of rapid change and globalization <\s>
<s> about one billion people worldwide profess the catholic faith <\s>
<s> honduras once part of spain's vast empire in the new world honduras became an independent nation in 1821 <\s>
<s> after two and a half decades of mostly military rule a freely elected civilian government came to power in 1982 <\s>
<s> during the 1980s honduras proved a haven for anti-sandinista contras fighting the marxist nicaraguan government and an ally to salvadoran government forces fighting leftist guerrillas <\s>
<s> the country was devastated by hurricane mitch in 1998 which killed about 5,600 people and caused approximately 2 billion in damage <\s>
<s> since then the economy has slowly rebounded <\s>
<s> hong kong occupied by the uk in 1841 hong kong was formally ceded by china the following year various adjacent lands were added later in the 19th century <\s>
<s> pursuant to an agreement signed by china and the uk on 19 december 1984 hong kong became the hong kong special administrative region sar of the people's republic of china on 1 july 1997 <\s>
<s> in this agreement china promised that under its one country two systems formula china's socialist economic system would not be imposed on hong kong and that hong kong would enjoy a high degree of autonomy in all matters except foreign and defense affairs for the next 50 years <\s>
<s> hungary hungary became a christian kingdom in a d <\s>
<s> 1000 and for many centuries served as a bulwark against ottoman turkish expansion in europe <\s>
<s> the kingdom eventually became part of the polyglot austro-hungarian empire which collapsed during world war i <\s>
<s> the country fell under communist rule following world war ii <\s>
<s> in 1956 a revolt and an announced withdrawal from the warsaw pact were met with a massive military intervention by moscow <\s>
<s> under the leadership of janos kadar in 1968 hungary began liberalizing its economy introducing so-called goulash communism <\s>
<s> hungary held its first multiparty elections in 1990 and initiated a free market economy <\s>
<s> it joined nato in 1999 and the eu in 2004 <\s>
<s> iceland settled by norwegian and celtic scottish and irish immigrants during the late 9th and 10th centuries a d iceland boasts the world's oldest functioning legislative assembly the althing established in 930 <\s>
<s> independent for over 300 years iceland was subsequently ruled by norway and denmark <\s>
<s> fallout from the askja volcano of 1875 devastated the icelandic economy and caused widespread famine <\s>
<s> over the next quarter century 20 of the island's population emigrated mostly to canada and the us <\s>
<s> limited home rule from denmark was granted in 1874 and complete independence attained in 1944 <\s>
<s> the second half of the 20th century saw substantial economic growth driven primarily by the fishing industry <\s>
<s> the economy diversified greatly after the country joined the european economic area in 1994 but iceland was especially hard hit by the global financial crisis in the years following 2008 <\s>
<s> literacy longevity and social cohesion are first rate by world standards <\s>
<s> india the indus valley civilization one of the world's oldest flourished during the 3rd and 2nd millennia b c <\s>
<s> and extended into northwestern india <\s>
<s> aryan tribes from the northwest infiltrated onto the indian subcontinent about 1500 b c their merger with the earlier dravidian inhabitants created the classical indian culture <\s>
<s> the maurya empire of the 4th and 3rd centuries b c <\s>
<s> which reached its zenith under ashoka united much of south asia <\s>
<s> the golden age ushered in by the gupta dynasty 4th to 6th centuries a d saw a flowering of indian science art and culture <\s>
<s> islam spread across the subcontinent over a period of 700 years <\s>
<s> in the 10th and 11th centuries turks and afghans invaded india and established the delhi sultanate <\s>
<s> in the early 16th century the emperor babur established the mughal dynasty which ruled india for more than three centuries <\s>

<s> conservative clerical forces established a theocratic system of government with ultimate political authority vested in a learned religious scholar referred to commonly as the supreme leader who according to the constitution is accountable only to the assembly of experts a popularly elected 86 member body of clerics <\s>
<s> us-iranian relations have been strained since a group of iranian students seized the us embassy in tehran on 4 november 1979 and held it until 20 january 1981 <\s>
<s> during 1980-88 iran fought a bloody indecisive war with iraq that eventually expanded into the persian gulf and led to clashes between us navy and iranian military forces between 1987 and 1988 <\s>
<s> iran has been designated a state sponsor of terrorism for its activities in lebanon and elsewhere in the world and remains subject to us un and eu economic sanctions and export controls because of its continued involvement in terrorism and its nuclear weapons ambitions <\s>
<s> following the election of reformer hojjat ol-eslam mohammad khatami as president in 1997 and a reformist majles legislature in 2000 a campaign to foster political reform in response to popular dissatisfaction was initiated <\s>
<s> the movement floundered as conservative politicians through the control of unelected institutions prevented reform measures from being enacted and increased repressive measures <\s>
<s> starting with nationwide municipal elections in 2003 and continuing through majles elections in 2004 conservatives reestablished control over iran's elected government institutions which culminated with the august 2005 inauguration of hardliner mahmud ahmadi-nejad as president <\s>
<s> his controversial reelection in june 2009 sparked nationwide protests over allegations of electoral fraud <\s>
<s> the un security council has passed a number of resolutions 1696 in july 2006 1737 in december 2006 1747 in march 2007 1803 in march 2008 and 1835 in september 2008 calling for iran to suspend its uranium enrichment and reprocessing activities and comply with its iaea obligations and responsibilities <\s>
<s> resolutions 1737 1477 and 1803 subject a number of iranian individuals and entities involved in iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs to sanctions <\s>
<s> additionally several iranian entities are subject to us sanctions under executive order 13382 designations for proliferation activities and eo 13224 designations for support of terrorism <\s>
<s> iraq formerly part of the ottoman empire iraq was occupied by britain during the course of world war i in 1920 it was declared a league of nations mandate under uk administration <\s>
<s> in stages over the next dozen years iraq attained its independence as a kingdom in 1932 <\s>
<s> a republic was proclaimed in 1958 but in actuality a series of strongmen ruled the country until 2003 <\s>
<s> the last was saddam husayn <\s>
<s> territorial disputes with iran led to an inconclusive and costly eight-year war 1980-88 <\s>
<s> in august 1990 iraq seized kuwait but was expelled by us-led un coalition forces during the gulf war of january-february 1991 <\s>
<s> following kuwait's liberation the un security council unsc required iraq to scrap all weapons of mass destruction and long-range missiles and to allow un verification inspections <\s>
<s> continued iraqi noncompliance with unsc resolutions over a period of 12 years led to the us-led invasion of iraq in march 2003 and the ouster of the saddam husayn regime <\s>
<s> us forces remained in iraq under a unsc mandate through 2009 and under a bilateral security agreement thereafter helping to provide security and to train and mentor iraqi security forces <\s>
<s> in october 2005 iraqis approved a constitution in a national referendum and pursuant to this document elected a 275 member council of representatives cor in december 2005 <\s>
<s> after the election ibrahim al-jafari was selected as prime minister he was replaced by nuri al-maliki in may 2006 <\s>
<s> the cor approved most cabinet ministers in may 2006 marking the transition to iraq's first constitutional government in nearly a half century <\s>
<s> on 31 january 2009 iraq held elections for provincial councils in all provinces except for the three provinces comprising the kurdistan regional government and kirkuk province <\s>
<s> iraq held a national legislative election in march 2010 and after nine months of deadlock the cor approved the new government in december <\s>
<s> ireland celtic tribes arrived on the island between 600-150 b c <\s>
<s> invasions by norsemen that began in the late 8th century were finally ended when king brian boru defeated the danes in 1014 <\s>
<s> english invasions began in the 12th century and set off more than seven centuries of anglo-irish struggle marked by fierce rebellions and harsh repressions <\s>
<s> a failed 1916 easter monday rebellion touched off several years of guerrilla warfare that in 1921 resulted in independence from the uk for 26 southern counties six northern ulster counties remained part of the uk <\s>
<s> in 1949 ireland withdrew from the british commonwealth it joined the european community in 1973 <\s>
<s> irish governments have sought the peaceful unification of ireland and have cooperated with britain against terrorist groups <\s>
<s> a peace settlement for northern ireland is gradually being implemented despite some difficulties <\s>
<s> in 2006 the irish and british governments developed and began to implement the st <\s>
<s> andrews agreement building on the good friday agreement approved in 1998 <\s>
<s> isle of man part of the norwegian kingdom of the hebrides until the 13th century when it was ceded to scotland the isle came under the british crown in 1765 <\s>
<s> current concerns include reviving the almost extinct manx gaelic language <\s>
<s> isle of man is a british crown dependency but is not part of the uk or of the european union <\s>
<s> however the uk government remains constitutionally responsible for its defense and international representation <\s>
<s> israel following world war ii the british withdrew from their mandate of palestine and the un partitioned the area into arab and jewish states an arrangement rejected by the arabs <\s>
<s> subsequently the israelis defeated the arabs in a series of wars without ending the deep tensions between the two sides <\s>
<s> the territories israel occupied since the 1967 war are not included in the israel country profile unless otherwise noted <\s>
<s> on 25 april 1982 israel withdrew from the sinai pursuant to the 1979 israel-egypt peace treaty <\s>
<s> disputes between a series of prisoner popes and italy were resolved in 1929 by three lateran treaties which established the independent state of vatican city and granted roman catholicism special status in italy <\s>
<s> in 1984 a concordat between the holy see and italy modified certain of the earlier treaty provisions including the primacy of roman catholicism as the italian state religion <\s>
<s> present concerns of the holy see include religious freedom international development the environment the middle east china the decline of religion in europe terrorism interreligious dialogue and reconciliation and the application of church doctrine in an era of rapid change and globalization <\s>
<s> about one billion people worldwide profess the catholic faith <\s>
<s> honduras once part of spain's vast empire in the new world honduras became an independent nation in 1821 <\s>
<s> after two and a half decades of mostly military rule a freely elected civilian government came to power in 1982 <\s>
<s> during the 1980s honduras proved a haven for anti-sandinista contras fighting the marxist nicaraguan government and an ally to salvadoran government forces fighting leftist guerrillas <\s>
<s> the country was devastated by hurricane mitch in 1998 which killed about 5,600 people and caused approximately 2 billion in damage <\s>
<s> since then the economy has slowly rebounded <\s>
<s> hong kong occupied by the uk in 1841 hong kong was formally ceded by china the following year various adjacent lands were added later in the 19th century <\s>
<s> pursuant to an agreement signed by china and the uk on 19 december 1984 hong kong became the hong kong special administrative region sar of the people's republic of china on 1 july 1997 <\s>
<s> in this agreement china promised that under its one country two systems formula china's socialist economic system would not be imposed on hong kong and that hong kong would enjoy a high degree of autonomy in all matters except foreign and defense affairs for the next 50 years <\s>
<s> hungary hungary became a christian kingdom in a d <\s>
<s> 1000 and for many centuries served as a bulwark against ottoman turkish expansion in europe <\s>
<s> the kingdom eventually became part of the polyglot austro-hungarian empire which collapsed during world war i <\s>
<s> the country fell under communist rule following world war ii <\s>
<s> in 1956 a revolt and an announced withdrawal from the warsaw pact were met with a massive military intervention by moscow <\s>
<s> under the leadership of janos kadar in 1968 hungary began liberalizing its economy introducing so-called goulash communism <\s>
<s> hungary held its first multiparty elections in 1990 and initiated a free market economy <\s>
<s> it joined nato in 1999 and the eu in 2004 <\s>
<s> iceland settled by norwegian and celtic scottish and irish immigrants during the late 9th and 10th centuries a d iceland boasts the world's oldest functioning legislative assembly the althing established in 930 <\s>
<s> independent for over 300 years iceland was subsequently ruled by norway and denmark <\s>
<s> fallout from the askja volcano of 1875 devastated the icelandic economy and caused widespread famine <\s>
<s> over the next quarter century 20 of the island's population emigrated mostly to canada and the us <\s>
<s> limited home rule from denmark was granted in 1874 and complete independence attained in 1944 <\s>
<s> the second half of the 20th century saw substantial economic growth driven primarily by the fishing industry <\s>
<s> the economy diversified greatly after the country joined the european economic area in 1994 but iceland was especially hard hit by the global financial crisis in the years following 2008 <\s>
<s> literacy longevity and social cohesion are first rate by world standards <\s>
<s> india the indus valley civilization one of the world's oldest flourished during the 3rd and 2nd millennia b c <\s>
<s> and extended into northwestern india <\s>
<s> aryan tribes from the northwest infiltrated onto the indian subcontinent about 1500 b c their merger with the earlier dravidian inhabitants created the classical indian culture <\s>
<s> the maurya empire of the 4th and 3rd centuries b c <\s>
<s> which reached its zenith under ashoka united much of south asia <\s>
<s> the golden age ushered in by the gupta dynasty 4th to 6th centuries a d saw a flowering of indian science art and culture <\s>
<s> islam spread across the subcontinent over a period of 700 years <\s>
<s> in the 10th and 11th centuries turks and afghans invaded india and established the delhi sultanate <\s>
<s> in the early 16th century the emperor babur established the mughal dynasty which ruled india for more than three centuries <\s>
<s> european explorers began establishing footholds in india during the 16th century <\s>
<s> by the 19th century great britain had become the dominant political power on the subcontinent <\s>
<s> the british indian army played a vital role in both world wars <\s>
<s> nonviolent resistance to british rule led by mohandas gandhi and jawaharlal nehru eventually brought about independence in 1947 <\s>
<s> communal violence led to the subcontinent's bloody partition which resulted in the creation of two separate states india and pakistan <\s>
<s> the two countries have fought three wars since independence the last of which in 1971 resulted in east pakistan becoming the separate nation of bangladesh <\s>
<s> india's nuclear weapons tests in 1998 caused pakistan to conduct its own tests that same year <\s>
<s> in november 2008 terrorists allegedly originating from pakistan conducted a series of coordinated attacks in mumbai india's financial capital <\s>
<s> despite pressing problems such as significant overpopulation environmental degradation extensive poverty and widespread corruption rapid economic development is fueling india's rise on the world stage <\s>
<s> in january 2011 india assumed a nonpermanent seat in the un security council for the 2011-12 term <\s>
<s> indian ocean the indian ocean is the third largest of the world's five oceans after the pacific ocean and atlantic ocean but larger than the southern ocean and arctic ocean <\s>
<s> four critically important access waterways are the suez canal egypt bab el mandeb djibouti-yemen strait of hormuz iran-oman and strait of malacca indonesia-malaysia <\s>
<s> the decision by the international hydrographic organization in the spring of 2000 to delimit a fifth ocean the southern ocean removed the portion of the indian ocean south of 60 degrees south latitude <\s>
<s> indonesia the dutch began to colonize indonesia in the early 17th century japan occupied the islands from 1942 to 1945 <\s>
<s> indonesia declared its independence after japan's surrender but it required four years of intermittent negotiations recurring hostilities and un mediation before the netherlands agreed to transfer sovereignty in 1949 <\s>
<s> free and fair legislative elections took place in 1999 after decades of repressive rule <\s>
<s> indonesia is now the world's third most populous democracy the world's largest archipelagic state and home to the world's largest muslim population <\s>
<s> current issues include alleviating poverty improving education preventing terrorism consolidating democracy after four decades of authoritarianism implementing economic and financial reforms stemming corruption holding the military and police accountable for human rights violations addressing climate change and controlling avian influenza <\s>
<s> in 2005 indonesia reached a historic peace agreement with armed separatists in aceh which led to democratic elections in aceh in december 2006 <\s>
<s> indonesia continues to face low intensity armed resistance by the separatist free papua movement <\s>
<s> iran known as persia until 1935 iran became an islamic republic in 1979 after the ruling monarchy was overthrown and shah mohammad reza pahlavi was forced into exile <\s>
<s> conservative clerical forces established a theocratic system of government with ultimate political authority vested in a learned religious scholar referred to commonly as the supreme leader who according to the constitution is accountable only to the assembly of experts a popularly elected 86 member body of clerics <\s>

<s> in october 2005 iraqis approved a constitution in a national referendum and pursuant to this document elected a 275 member council of representatives cor in december 2005 <\s>
<s> after the election ibrahim al-jafari was selected as prime minister he was replaced by nuri al-maliki in may 2006 <\s>
<s> the cor approved most cabinet ministers in may 2006 marking the transition to iraq's first constitutional government in nearly a half century <\s>
<s> on 31 january 2009 iraq held elections for provincial councils in all provinces except for the three provinces comprising the kurdistan regional government and kirkuk province <\s>
<s> iraq held a national legislative election in march 2010 and after nine months of deadlock the cor approved the new government in december <\s>
<s> ireland celtic tribes arrived on the island between 600-150 b c <\s>
<s> invasions by norsemen that began in the late 8th century were finally ended when king brian boru defeated the danes in 1014 <\s>
<s> english invasions began in the 12th century and set off more than seven centuries of anglo-irish struggle marked by fierce rebellions and harsh repressions <\s>
<s> a failed 1916 easter monday rebellion touched off several years of guerrilla warfare that in 1921 resulted in independence from the uk for 26 southern counties six northern ulster counties remained part of the uk <\s>
<s> in 1949 ireland withdrew from the british commonwealth it joined the european community in 1973 <\s>
<s> irish governments have sought the peaceful unification of ireland and have cooperated with britain against terrorist groups <\s>
<s> a peace settlement for northern ireland is gradually being implemented despite some difficulties <\s>
<s> in 2006 the irish and british governments developed and began to implement the st <\s>
<s> andrews agreement building on the good friday agreement approved in 1998 <\s>
<s> isle of man part of the norwegian kingdom of the hebrides until the 13th century when it was ceded to scotland the isle came under the british crown in 1765 <\s>
<s> current concerns include reviving the almost extinct manx gaelic language <\s>
<s> isle of man is a british crown dependency but is not part of the uk or of the european union <\s>
<s> however the uk government remains constitutionally responsible for its defense and international representation <\s>
<s> israel following world war ii the british withdrew from their mandate of palestine and the un partitioned the area into arab and jewish states an arrangement rejected by the arabs <\s>
<s> subsequently the israelis defeated the arabs in a series of wars without ending the deep tensions between the two sides <\s>
<s> the territories israel occupied since the 1967 war are not included in the israel country profile unless otherwise noted <\s>
<s> on 25 april 1982 israel withdrew from the sinai pursuant to the 1979 israel-egypt peace treaty <\s>
<s> disputes between a series of prisoner popes and italy were resolved in 1929 by three lateran treaties which established the independent state of vatican city and granted roman catholicism special status in italy <\s>
<s> in 1984 a concordat between the holy see and italy modified certain of the earlier treaty provisions including the primacy of roman catholicism as the italian state religion <\s>
<s> present concerns of the holy see include religious freedom international development the environment the middle east china the decline of religion in europe terrorism interreligious dialogue and reconciliation and the application of church doctrine in an era of rapid change and globalization <\s>
<s> about one billion people worldwide profess the catholic faith <\s>
<s> honduras once part of spain's vast empire in the new world honduras became an independent nation in 1821 <\s>
<s> after two and a half decades of mostly military rule a freely elected civilian government came to power in 1982 <\s>
<s> during the 1980s honduras proved a haven for anti-sandinista contras fighting the marxist nicaraguan government and an ally to salvadoran government forces fighting leftist guerrillas <\s>
<s> the country was devastated by hurricane mitch in 1998 which killed about 5,600 people and caused approximately 2 billion in damage <\s>
<s> since then the economy has slowly rebounded <\s>
<s> hong kong occupied by the uk in 1841 hong kong was formally ceded by china the following year various adjacent lands were added later in the 19th century <\s>
<s> pursuant to an agreement signed by china and the uk on 19 december 1984 hong kong became the hong kong special administrative region sar of the people's republic of china on 1 july 1997 <\s>
<s> in this agreement china promised that under its one country two systems formula china's socialist economic system would not be imposed on hong kong and that hong kong would enjoy a high degree of autonomy in all matters except foreign and defense affairs for the next 50 years <\s>
<s> hungary hungary became a christian kingdom in a d <\s>
<s> 1000 and for many centuries served as a bulwark against ottoman turkish expansion in europe <\s>
<s> the kingdom eventually became part of the polyglot austro-hungarian empire which collapsed during world war i <\s>
<s> the country fell under communist rule following world war ii <\s>
<s> in 1956 a revolt and an announced withdrawal from the warsaw pact were met with a massive military intervention by moscow <\s>
<s> under the leadership of janos kadar in 1968 hungary began liberalizing its economy introducing so-called goulash communism <\s>
<s> hungary held its first multiparty elections in 1990 and initiated a free market economy <\s>
<s> it joined nato in 1999 and the eu in 2004 <\s>
<s> iceland settled by norwegian and celtic scottish and irish immigrants during the late 9th and 10th centuries a d iceland boasts the world's oldest functioning legislative assembly the althing established in 930 <\s>
<s> independent for over 300 years iceland was subsequently ruled by norway and denmark <\s>
<s> fallout from the askja volcano of 1875 devastated the icelandic economy and caused widespread famine <\s>
<s> over the next quarter century 20 of the island's population emigrated mostly to canada and the us <\s>
<s> limited home rule from denmark was granted in 1874 and complete independence attained in 1944 <\s>
<s> the second half of the 20th century saw substantial economic growth driven primarily by the fishing industry <\s>
<s> the economy diversified greatly after the country joined the european economic area in 1994 but iceland was especially hard hit by the global financial crisis in the years following 2008 <\s>
<s> literacy longevity and social cohesion are first rate by world standards <\s>
<s> india the indus valley civilization one of the world's oldest flourished during the 3rd and 2nd millennia b c <\s>
<s> and extended into northwestern india <\s>
<s> aryan tribes from the northwest infiltrated onto the indian subcontinent about 1500 b c their merger with the earlier dravidian inhabitants created the classical indian culture <\s>
<s> the maurya empire of the 4th and 3rd centuries b c <\s>
<s> which reached its zenith under ashoka united much of south asia <\s>
<s> the golden age ushered in by the gupta dynasty 4th to 6th centuries a d saw a flowering of indian science art and culture <\s>
<s> islam spread across the subcontinent over a period of 700 years <\s>
<s> in the 10th and 11th centuries turks and afghans invaded india and established the delhi sultanate <\s>
<s> in the early 16th century the emperor babur established the mughal dynasty which ruled india for more than three centuries <\s>
<s> european explorers began establishing footholds in india during the 16th century <\s>
<s> by the 19th century great britain had become the dominant political power on the subcontinent <\s>
<s> the british indian army played a vital role in both world wars <\s>
<s> nonviolent resistance to british rule led by mohandas gandhi and jawaharlal nehru eventually brought about independence in 1947 <\s>
<s> communal violence led to the subcontinent's bloody partition which resulted in the creation of two separate states india and pakistan <\s>
<s> the two countries have fought three wars since independence the last of which in 1971 resulted in east pakistan becoming the separate nation of bangladesh <\s>
<s> india's nuclear weapons tests in 1998 caused pakistan to conduct its own tests that same year <\s>
<s> in november 2008 terrorists allegedly originating from pakistan conducted a series of coordinated attacks in mumbai india's financial capital <\s>
<s> despite pressing problems such as significant overpopulation environmental degradation extensive poverty and widespread corruption rapid economic development is fueling india's rise on the world stage <\s>
<s> in january 2011 india assumed a nonpermanent seat in the un security council for the 2011-12 term <\s>
<s> indian ocean the indian ocean is the third largest of the world's five oceans after the pacific ocean and atlantic ocean but larger than the southern ocean and arctic ocean <\s>
<s> four critically important access waterways are the suez canal egypt bab el mandeb djibouti-yemen strait of hormuz iran-oman and strait of malacca indonesia-malaysia <\s>
<s> the decision by the international hydrographic organization in the spring of 2000 to delimit a fifth ocean the southern ocean removed the portion of the indian ocean south of 60 degrees south latitude <\s>
<s> indonesia the dutch began to colonize indonesia in the early 17th century japan occupied the islands from 1942 to 1945 <\s>
<s> indonesia declared its independence after japan's surrender but it required four years of intermittent negotiations recurring hostilities and un mediation before the netherlands agreed to transfer sovereignty in 1949 <\s>
<s> free and fair legislative elections took place in 1999 after decades of repressive rule <\s>
<s> indonesia is now the world's third most populous democracy the world's largest archipelagic state and home to the world's largest muslim population <\s>
<s> current issues include alleviating poverty improving education preventing terrorism consolidating democracy after four decades of authoritarianism implementing economic and financial reforms stemming corruption holding the military and police accountable for human rights violations addressing climate change and controlling avian influenza <\s>
<s> in 2005 indonesia reached a historic peace agreement with armed separatists in aceh which led to democratic elections in aceh in december 2006 <\s>
<s> indonesia continues to face low intensity armed resistance by the separatist free papua movement <\s>
<s> iran known as persia until 1935 iran became an islamic republic in 1979 after the ruling monarchy was overthrown and shah mohammad reza pahlavi was forced into exile <\s>
<s> conservative clerical forces established a theocratic system of government with ultimate political authority vested in a learned religious scholar referred to commonly as the supreme leader who according to the constitution is accountable only to the assembly of experts a popularly elected 86 member body of clerics <\s>
<s> us-iranian relations have been strained since a group of iranian students seized the us embassy in tehran on 4 november 1979 and held it until 20 january 1981 <\s>
<s> during 1980-88 iran fought a bloody indecisive war with iraq that eventually expanded into the persian gulf and led to clashes between us navy and iranian military forces between 1987 and 1988 <\s>
<s> iran has been designated a state sponsor of terrorism for its activities in lebanon and elsewhere in the world and remains subject to us un and eu economic sanctions and export controls because of its continued involvement in terrorism and its nuclear weapons ambitions <\s>
<s> following the election of reformer hojjat ol-eslam mohammad khatami as president in 1997 and a reformist majles legislature in 2000 a campaign to foster political reform in response to popular dissatisfaction was initiated <\s>
<s> the movement floundered as conservative politicians through the control of unelected institutions prevented reform measures from being enacted and increased repressive measures <\s>
<s> starting with nationwide municipal elections in 2003 and continuing through majles elections in 2004 conservatives reestablished control over iran's elected government institutions which culminated with the august 2005 inauguration of hardliner mahmud ahmadi-nejad as president <\s>
<s> his controversial reelection in june 2009 sparked nationwide protests over allegations of electoral fraud <\s>
<s> the un security council has passed a number of resolutions 1696 in july 2006 1737 in december 2006 1747 in march 2007 1803 in march 2008 and 1835 in september 2008 calling for iran to suspend its uranium enrichment and reprocessing activities and comply with its iaea obligations and responsibilities <\s>
<s> resolutions 1737 1477 and 1803 subject a number of iranian individuals and entities involved in iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs to sanctions <\s>
<s> additionally several iranian entities are subject to us sanctions under executive order 13382 designations for proliferation activities and eo 13224 designations for support of terrorism <\s>
<s> iraq formerly part of the ottoman empire iraq was occupied by britain during the course of world war i in 1920 it was declared a league of nations mandate under uk administration <\s>
<s> in stages over the next dozen years iraq attained its independence as a kingdom in 1932 <\s>
<s> a republic was proclaimed in 1958 but in actuality a series of strongmen ruled the country until 2003 <\s>
<s> the last was saddam husayn <\s>
<s> territorial disputes with iran led to an inconclusive and costly eight-year war 1980-88 <\s>
<s> in august 1990 iraq seized kuwait but was expelled by us-led un coalition forces during the gulf war of january-february 1991 <\s>
<s> following kuwait's liberation the un security council unsc required iraq to scrap all weapons of mass destruction and long-range missiles and to allow un verification inspections <\s>
<s> continued iraqi noncompliance with unsc resolutions over a period of 12 years led to the us-led invasion of iraq in march 2003 and the ouster of the saddam husayn regime <\s>
<s> us forces remained in iraq under a unsc mandate through 2009 and under a bilateral security agreement thereafter helping to provide security and to train and mentor iraqi security forces <\s>
<s> in october 2005 iraqis approved a constitution in a national referendum and pursuant to this document elected a 275 member council of representatives cor in december 2005 <\s>
<s> after the election ibrahim al-jafari was selected as prime minister he was replaced by nuri al-maliki in may 2006 <\s>
<s> the cor approved most cabinet ministers in may 2006 marking the transition to iraq's first constitutional government in nearly a half century <\s>
<s> on 31 january 2009 iraq held elections for provincial councils in all provinces except for the three provinces comprising the kurdistan regional government and kirkuk province <\s>
<s> iraq held a national legislative election in march 2010 and after nine months of deadlock the cor approved the new government in december <\s>

<s> current concerns include reviving the almost extinct manx gaelic language <\s>
<s> isle of man is a british crown dependency but is not part of the uk or of the european union <\s>
<s> however the uk government remains constitutionally responsible for its defense and international representation <\s>
